rounds.event: The Hanafi Siege: In a 39-hour standoff, armed Hanafi Muslims seize three Washington, D.C., buildings.
births: Radek Dvořák, Czech ice hockey player

rounds.event: Bolton Wanderers stadium disaster at Burnden Park, Bolton, England, kills 33 and injures hundreds more.
births: Bernd Hölzenbein, German footballer and scout
Warren Skaaren, American screenwriter and producer

rounds.event: Comet Hale–Bopp: Observers in China, Mongolia and eastern Siberia are treated to a rare double feature as an eclipse permits Hale-Bopp to be seen during the day.
deaths: Jean-Dominique Bauby, French journalist and author
Terry Nation, Welsh author and screenwriter
The Notorious B.I.G., American rapper, songwriter, and actor

rounds.event: The 8.6 Andreanof Islands earthquake shakes the Aleutian Islands, causing over $5 million in damage from ground movement and a destructive tsunami.
McCarthyism: CBS television broadcasts the See It Now episode, "A Report on Senator Joseph McCarthy", produced by Fred Friendly.
births: Bobby Sands, PIRA volunteer; Irish republican politician
deaths: Vagn Walfrid Ekman, Swedish oceanographer and academic
